intro: Wahlenbergia telfordii, commonly known as the Telford's forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, bell-shaped blooms. Wahlenbergia telfordii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
